intro: Euphrasia scutellarioides, commonly known as the yellow eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that resemble eyes, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Euphrasia scutellarioides is known for its medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
